ingredients.name: dry white wine (Sauvignon Blanc or Pinot Grigio)
(8 cups) low-sodium chicken or vegetable stock
6–7 sprigs fresh thyme (plus extra for garnish)

recipes.name: Mesa Melt – Southwest Beer Cheese

ingredients.name: roasted Hatch green chiles, peeled, seeded, and diced

instructions: Prepare the Roux: In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1–2 minutes, until lightly golden and aromatic.
Incorporate Beer: Slowly pour in the beer while whisking continuously. Allow it to foam, then simmer for 1–2 minutes until slightly thickened.
Add Milk: Whisk in the milk or half-and-half, stirring until smooth and gently thickened.
Melt the Cheeses: Reduce heat to medium-low. Add cheddar, pepper jack, and cream cheese gradually, whisking until fully melted and smooth.
Integrate Flavors: Stir in roasted Hatch chiles, chipotle, smoked paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt. Mix thoroughly to incorporate.
Adjust Consistency: For a thinner sauce, add small increments of milk or beer until desired texture is reached. For thicker consistency, continue simmering gently.
Hold Warm for Service: Keep over low heat or in a warm holding unit until ready for use. Avoid boiling once cheese is added to maintain a smooth texture.

recipes.name: Buttermilk Brine
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cambro and whisk.

recipes.name: Queso/ Mac Sauce
instructions: Combine milk and heavy cream in large sauce pot and bring to a boil
Shred cheese blocks in Robocoupe
Slowly incorporate shredded cheese blocks and shredded cheddar into boiling pot, stirring until thoroughly melted
Transfer into 22 Qt. cambro and insert ice wand

recipes.name: Grilled Three-Cheese Sandwich
instructions: For Cream Cheese Spread:
Combine cream cheese, Double Gloucester or cheddar, heavy cream, and salt in food processor. Blend until smooth. Set aside.
For Garlic Spread:
Combine mayonnaise, garlic, and salt in small bowl and stir until blended. Set aside.
For Grilled Three-Cheese Sandwich:
Lay out artisan bread slices on parchment paper or large cutting board.
Place 2 slices of cheddar on 4 of the bread slices. Place 2 slices of provolone on remaining bread slices.
Equally spoon cream cheese spread on slices with provolone. Gently smooth cream cheese spread over each slice.
Press cheddar side and provolone side together.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes, until hot.
Brush both sides of the sandwiches with garlic spread.
Grill sandwiches for 2 minutes on each side, until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown.

ingredients.name: Sachet (20 grams rosemary parsley tarragon and thyme)

recipes.name: Chicken Confit
instructions: “French” chicken legs
